Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Sequence: 1. RO happens first. 2. CA must happen after RO. 3. RI must happen after CA (cant reserve if not checked). 4. PI must happen after RI (cant pick unreserved items usually). 5. QC must happen after PI. 6. PO must happen after QC. 7. GSL usually happens around packing or just before dispatch. Lets say before Dispatch. 8. D happens after PO and GSL. 9. IC usually happens after Dispatch or around Packing. Lets say after D. 10. RP happens after IC.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Determine Constraints based on Business Logic: I need to infer logical relationships between these activities to populate the dictionary keys. Real-world process knowledge is required here.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Drafting the Dictionary: equivalence: {('PO', 'GSL')} (Pack and Label go hand in hand). always_before: {('CA', 'RO'), ('RI', 'CA'), ('PI', 'RI'), ('QC', 'PI'), ('PO', 'QC'), ('D', 'PO'), ('GSL', 'PO'), ('IC', 'D'), ('RP', 'IC')}. always_after: {('RO', 'CA'), ('CA', 'RI'), ('RI', 'PI'), ('PI', 'QC'), ('QC', 'PO'), ('PO', 'GSL'), ('GSL', 'D'), ('D', 'IC'), ('IC', 'RP')}. never_together: set().

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Review against Definitions: Self-Correction on always_before semantics: Prompt: If the first activity occurs, then the second activity should have been executed previously. Tuple (A, B). Meaning: If A happens, B happened before. Example: ('CA', 'RO'). If Check Availability happens, Receive Order happened before. Correct.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Frequencies: RO: Exactly 1 per order. CA, RI, PI, QC, PO, GSL, D, IC: Usually 1 per order. RP: Could be 0 (if unpaid yet) or 1.

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: never_together: set() (No mutually exclusive paths defined in the text). Wait, better to provide a plausible constraint. Decision: I will leave never_together empty or add a hypothetical constraint if I assume a variation not listed. Better to leave it empty set() if the process is strictly linear.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Code Construction: Define the activity codes. Construct the sets of tuples. Construct the frequency dictionary. Assemble the main dictionary.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Final Check: Does the output match the requested format exactly? Keys: equivalence, always_before, always_after, never_together, activ_freq, directly_follows. Values: Sets of tuples for constraints, Dict of Sets for freq.
